basicInfo.notes: Managed cloud hosting platform founded in Malta, acquired by DigitalOcean in September 2022 for $350 million. Acts as an intermediary that manages cloud infrastructure from AWS, Google Cloud, DigitalOcean, Linode, and Vultr. 280+ employees at time of acquisition. Now serves 124,000+ customers paying over $50/month. Known for pay-as-you-go pricing and excellent support with 90-second average response time.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: No money-back guarantee; pay-as-you-go model means you only pay for resources used; unused prepaid funds can be refunded within 3 months of adding funds

serverPerformance.ddosProtectionLevel: Bot Protection and Firewall via Cloudflare

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: Pay-as-you-go; bandwidth included varies by plan (1TB base); overage charged at provider rates
policiesOverages.storageOveragePolicy: Pay-as-you-go; can upgrade server size or add block storage
policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: Account suspended for TOS violations; servers still billed until deleted; fraud prevention enforcement active
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Illegal activities; adult content; copyright violations; resource misuse affecting other users
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: No traditional promo-to-renewal markup (pay-as-you-go); Email hosting not included (must use third-party like Rackspace at $1/user/mo); DNS hosting is add-on; Backup storage charged at $0.033/GB; Premium Support is paid add-on; No domain registration; Charged in arrears for previous month usage

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: Up to $125 per referral or lifetime 7% recurring; 90-day cookie

editorial.knownIssues: Email hosting not included (requires third-party add-on at extra cost); No domain registration; Backup storage charged separately at $0.033/GB; DNS hosting is paid add-on; Premium Support with phone/Slack costs extra; Pay-as-you-go billing can be confusing; Charged in arrears for previous month; Some users report billing issues and being charged after cancellation; No cPanel (proprietary panel); Post-DigitalOcean acquisition some users report declining support quality
editorial.bestFor: Developers and agencies needing managed cloud hosting; WordPress/WooCommerce sites needing scalable performance; Users wanting flexibility across AWS, GCP, DO, Vultr, Linode; Teams needing staging environments and Git deployment; Growing businesses that need to scale quickly; Users who want cloud power without server management
editorial.avoidIf: Need email hosting included; Want traditional shared hosting pricing; Prefer cPanel; Need domain registration; Budget-conscious with predictable monthly costs; New to web hosting (steeper learning curve)
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Pay-as-you-go vs fixed pricing (unlike Hostinger/SiteGround); Managed cloud layer on top of AWS/GCP/DO/Vultr/Linode (unique model); No email included (unlike traditional hosts); Higher price point but more flexible scaling; 65+ data centers via cloud providers (more than most); Cloudflare Enterprise CDN included; Acquired by DigitalOcean 2022; Trustpilot 4.6 and G2 4.7 among highest in industry

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Managed cloud hosting across 5 providers (AWS, GCP, DO, Vultr, Linode) with pay-as-you-go flexibility
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Developer or agency wanting managed cloud power without server administration complexity

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: Cloudways is excellent for developers and agencies needing managed cloud hosting with flexibility across AWS, Google Cloud, DigitalOcean, Vultr, and Linode, but lacks email hosting and traditional cPanel.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: Cloudways was acquired by DigitalOcean in September 2022 for $350 million. Originally founded in Malta in 2011.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: Cloudways uses pay-as-you-go pricing starting at $14/month for DigitalOcean and $11/month for Vultr. No promo-to-renewal markup.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Cloudways has a learning curve and is better suited for developers. Beginners may find traditional shared hosting easier.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: No, Cloudways does not include email hosting. You need third-party email like Rackspace ($1/user/month) or Gmail.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, Cloudways offers optimized WordPress hosting with staging, auto-updates, Redis caching, and Cloudflare Enterprise CDN.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: Cloudways guarantees 99.99% uptime with SLA credits for downtime.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, Cloudways is pay-as-you-go with no contracts. You're billed monthly in arrears for usage. There's a 3-day free trial.
